intro: Chamelaucium plumosum, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer to autumn. The plant has a low-growing habit with wiry stems and narrow, needle-like leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Chamelaucium plumosum is adapted to withstand salt spray and is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
